properties.address: The Pavilion, Ashbourne, Derbyshire DE6 1EJ
properties.description: This space is open to parents, carers, grandparents and their little ones from 9:30 until 12noon. There is a seating area and a space for children to play with toys, equipment and read stories. Free teas, coffees and snacks for the children. Changing facilities and disabled facilities are also on site.
properties.title: Ashbourne Pavilion

properties.address: Bridge Street, Belper, Derbyshire DE56 1BA
properties.description: The space is on the upper floor of the pavilion
properties.title: Belper Meadows Community Sports Club

properties.address: Cariad Corner, Belper, derbyshire DE56 1AP
properties.description: Cariad Corner, our community ran café is an extension of our Recovery Hub and ran as a volunteer led community café. Cariad Corner offers warm drinks, snacks and basic meals. Partnering with agencies that we already have good relationships with, we have extended our current program of activities in the Recovery Hub to include activities undertaken at Cariad Corner including: Healthy food and cooking workshops with local food banks, incorporating education around basic meal preparation and how to best utilise ingredients and items from their food bank Nutrition, Healthy Living and exercise workshops with Energee, including food motivation techniques Lived experience volunteer pathway training opportunities in regard to hospitality and health and social care with Derbyshire County Council Adult Education Running Multiply and Brightside adult learning courses, incorporating maths skills into cooking and supported learning with healthy cooking on a budget for adults with learning disabilities Neurodiverse Cooking sessions, education and support around neurodiversity and eating Family based cookery sessions incorporating locality grown and sourced ingredients encouraging open and honest communication and increasing connection and many more activities throughout the year
properties.title: Cariad Corner - Warm Hearts, Fresh Starts

properties.address: Ashbourne Elim Church, Ashbourne, Derbyshire DE6 1DG
properties.description: Open every Wedneaday morning from 9.30 till 12.
properties.title: Coffee & Toast Cafe

properties.address: Derby County Football Club, Derby, Derbyshire DE24 8XL
properties.description: Based in the old Starbucks/Back Yard coffee house at the stadium, which is situated in the north west corner of Pride Park Stadium.
properties.title: Community Corner - Harrison's Hub

properties.address: The Royal British Legion, Ashbourne, Derbyshire DE6 1QJ
properties.description: Parwich Royal British Legion Club is a social space in the heart of the village of Parwich in the Peak District National Park. The Club has established a Community Hub, where every Friday from 9am to 1pm, all are welcome to join us for coffee and tea cakes, or sausage cobs and a pot of tea, plus warmth and company.
properties.title: Community Hub

properties.address: West End Community Centre, Derby, Derbyshire DE22 3BL
properties.description: Open every Wednesday from 10.30am - 2pm with free hot drinks, biscuits, and a community lunch served between 12/12-30 and 1pm. Games, conversation, and magazines available, as well as an informal signposting service for those needing additional support.
properties.title: Community Living Room

properties.address: 51 Compton, Derbyshire DE6 1BX
properties.description: Snug area of the Social Club
properties.title: Compton Sports & Social Club

properties.address: Ashbourne Elim Pentecostal Church, Derbyshire DE6 1DG
properties.description: Ashbourne Elim Church provides a welcoming and secure environment. We offer hot drinks and toast. Games are also available for entertainment, and a play area for children if needed. To ensure safety, at least two DBS-checked personnel will always be present. You can find our comprehensive safeguarding policy on our website. Our opening times are Monday, 10/12 Wednesday, 9/12 Every second Wednesday of the month, we have a cooked, real, from noon pre-book, please.
properties.title: Foodbank and Drop-in Free Café

properties.address: Crich Glebe Community Centre, Matlock, Derbyshire DE4 5EU
properties.description: This is a warm, cosy space which is open to everyone on a Monday - Friday from 9.30am - 4.30pm. There are comfortable chairs and books or puzzles available if you come alone. Or there are games to play if others are there too. There is also free wi-fi and power points, so you can even work from the location if you like. Free tea and coffee is available as well as biscuits.
properties.title: Glebe Community Room

properties.address: No 28 Community Hall, Belper, Derbyshire DE56 1FZ
properties.description: We are open every Monday 10am to 4pm. Free tea, coffee and biscuits are available but no other food. A free tutor led craft session is offered most weeks, starting at 1pm. A jigsaw puzzle is usually on the go for you to join in whenever feel like it and is a good icebreaker for conversation. Knitting, crochet, sewing and quilting experts frequent our space, so bring your projects along for inspiration. A limited number of books, magazines and games are available.
properties.title: Happy Monday

properties.address: Haslemere Court Grange Street Derby DE23 8JJ, Derby, Derbyshire DE23 8JJ
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 25th November 2024** This is a communal Room at Haslemere Court can hold up to around 30 People. This can be used on a Tuesday Morning from 11 - 1pm
properties.title: Haslemere Court

properties.address: Hurst Opticians, Ripley, Derbyshire DE5 3AB
properties.description: The space is open to all 7 seats available.
properties.title: Hurst Opticians

properties.address: Derby City Council, Derbyshire DE22 4BG
properties.description: Derby Libraries will be providing warm spaces with extra seating and free hot drinks to support communities with the cost of living this winter. The spaces will be available to all to relax and connect in a safe, warm, welcoming space. Library staff will be on hand to support people who want to join the library and borrow books as well as sign post people to support and trusted information on the cost of living. There will also be opportunities for people to access a busy regular programme of free activities in the libraries from family rhymetimes to adult book groups. To protect the planet and reduce the use of plastic people are encouraged to bring their own cups into libraries. Everyone is welcome to unlimited refills of tea and coffee. Hot drinks will be available Monday 10am-1pm
properties.title: Mackworth Library

properties.address: Marehay Methodist Church, Warmwells Lane, Marehay, Ripley DE5 8JE
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 6th November 2023** Lunch club, drinks, food, games, company. Phone charging available. Linked with a food bank at our sister church Waingroves Methodist Church Open the first monday of the month 11am -1.30pm January 8th (not 1st)
properties.title: Marehay Methodist Church

properties.address: New Life Church Derby, Normanton Road, Derby, Derbyshire DE23 6UU
properties.description: Our Warm Space is open to families from 10-12. Parents and toddlers are welcome to build community and friendships. Lunch is provided from 12-2pm for anyone else in the community.
properties.title: New Life Church Derby

properties.address: Restoration Cafe, Matlock Bath, Derbyshire DE4 3NR
properties.description: Our warm cafe open 7 days per week with delicious food and drinks, and people to chat to.
properties.title: Restoration Cafe

properties.address: The Council House, Corporation Street, Derby, Derbyshire DE1 2FS
properties.description: Derby Libraries will be providing warm spaces with extra seating and free hot drinks to support communities with the cost of living this winter. The spaces will be available to all to relax and connect in a safe, warm, welcoming space. Library staff will be on hand to support people who want to join the library and borrow books as well as sign post people to support and trusted information on the cost of living. There will also be opportunities for people to access a busy regular programme of free activities in the libraries from family rhymetimes to adult book groups. properties.address: 11 Strutt Street, Belper, Derbyshire DE56 1UN
properties.description: The space is open to all. Cuppa and biscuits. We have board games, dominoes, a darts board, crafts, lots of nattering and good company. We also have a pool table and two snooker tables( £1 a game)
properties.title: Royal British Legion Club Belper

properties.address: Ashbourne Elim Church, Ashbourne, Derbyshire DE6 1DG
properties.description: The Fresh Soup evening is going well. We will be open from 5:30 PM until 6:30 PM, asking people to gather and enjoy. The table game will be set up alongside a PS5 on the large screen. This gaming aspect encourages social interaction and engagement among people. Promotional efforts have also begun, targeting the local community and potential people to ensure a good turnout. Overall, we are confident that the soup evening will be a successful and enjoyable event for all.
properties.title: Soup Evening

properties.address: Ashbourne Elim Church, Ashbourne, Derbyshire DE6 1DG
properties.description: On Monday, from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m., we provide a space for individuals to use laptops, access the Internet, and utilize printers. Our staff is available to assist with online issues, claims, or any other digital concerns.
properties.title: Tec-bridge

properties.address: 22, Matlock, Derbyshire DE4 3LT
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 9th February 2024** STARTING ON FRIDAY 9TH FEBUARY, 9.30am to 12pm. Fully accessible venue. The café bar is situated on Dale Road, Matlock within walking distance of Matlock station. A welcoming versatile cafe space which offers comfortable varied seating options and spaces for privacy. Those attending will be warmly welcomed, offered free hot drink, snack with an open invitation to receive support during the session from the Mental Health Wellbeing Practitioner, access the ‘pick and mix’ Well being Activity Packs and receive relevant sign positing information for other services. We would like to reach out to those who may be experiencing loneliness, isolation,financial hardship, emotional distress, carer stress, younger through to older local people.
properties.title: The Connection Space CIC at Bod Matlock

properties.address: 5 Liversage Street, Derby, Derbyshire DE1 2LD
properties.description: A warm welcoming space for people in Derby who are at risk of homelessness, poverty and social isolation. Free hot meals for breakfast and lunch or emergency food parcels. Shower, toilet and laundry facilities. Support advice and guidance on a range of issues such as healthcare, welfare, housing, debt and unemployment. Wellbeing sessions such as art, music and gardening. All free of Charge
